reviews.review: 神作不解釋
Oyun çok zevkli fakat 2 beyinsiz olarak hiçbir şey yapamıyoruz.
very good game

Played through single player numerous times and co-op several times with different friends. A solid, enjoyable experience of relatively easy and sometimes moderate puzzles.

The single player is very cinematic at times, linear and story driven, all the while adding new elements into the game's puzzles, accompanied by voices of GladOS and Wheatly, the latter being a silly little comic relief ball who decided to help free you from Aperture's decaying facility. The characters and environments all have a certain charm to them, all the way down to the little turrets that try to kill you but scream helplessly when they are flying left and right after being knocked over by some flying companion cube. Sounds silly right? Portal mostly is.

The controls are smooth, the visuals easy to read, the soundtrack variable and appropriate; sometimes haunting, othertimes calm, pensive or even tense in some situations. The story is alright, I'm not going to say stellar, because for me personally, the pacing is a little off in places and characters are annoying and old [b]fast[/b].

The issues with pacing come in so far as the middle section of the game where you find yourself exploring the lower layers of Aperture's facility which predate GladOS etc; the setting is different and unique, but the game just feels SO SLOW at this point. I remember my time on my first playthrough thinking "I wish I could get back to the modern stuff". I don't know about anyone else, but the contrast between old and modern aesthetics really contributed to a sense of boredom within me, even though you are getting backstory to Aperture in an amusing way all the while.

The issues with the characters merely depend on how much you like the characters and their personalities, because GladOS is, well, GladOS; taunting, condescending, dispassionate and amusing. Meanwhile Wheatly is supposed to be funny, clumsy, bumbling, stupid (fact, not opinion), and interfering. While I enjoy the feeling of GladOS watching me go about my merry way in puzzles because there is usually some quip that is a little left-field and as such surprising and amusing. Whereas Wheatly is silly by design and there is only so much "Oops I made a mistake, lets break things to make it better" humour before it gets really old, REALLY FAST.

These latter criticisms of Portal 2 have a common theme; an element of boredom. Even with the interesting environments and things happening within the story, ultimately it boils down to the same actions over and over again, to a very linear, single-solution puzzle solving experience where at times it feels a little more like 'Do what you're supposed to in order to progress' than straight up puzzle solving. The locations can feed into this as well as aesthetics get boring (hence why they probably felt the need to change it mid-game. Equally, the characters are very limited in their interaction with you, and it really depends on your sense of humour as to whether you will either love or hate Wheatly. But with a style of humour quite so divisive, you will either find yourself bored or enthused for much of the game.

The game does come into it's own though in 2 ways; the process of changing the status quo (i.e. running amok in aperture outside of established puzzle rooms) as this gives you backstory and fleshes out the world in a variety of ways, and in the co-op wherein the potential for puzzles are magnified because of a second pair of portals flying around. There are some really creative and different challenges in co-op which are unlike anything you will have come across in single-player and is defintely worth exploring with a friend - as long as you can cope with many a foolish death from both of you.

There is now even support for community made puzzles in the workshop and these can provide some of the most challenging puzzles you will probably ever try to solve with portals - orders of magnitude better and more difficult than in the game itself. Sadly this only feeds into the contrast and a feeling that the game is just too easy and is less puzzle solving and more "Put the portal where you are told like a good little human". 

Overall however, most definitely worth it's asking price based on the inclusion of co-op and workshop support. Might want to give the first portal a go first though, to get you up to speed with what is going on in the world before you begin. Plus, it's a nice nostalgia trip into old-game land, introduces you to portals and GladOS, and is a short, compact experience.

Portal 2 is a fun puzzle game, and has an interesting story line as well. You don't need to pplay the original to understand the game, and is fun for everyone. The puzzle rooms can be a little challenging sometimes, and may require a bit of thinking. Easy to understand controls and a multiplayer function means you can enjoy the game even when you finish the storyline. Definitely a good game to give a try

Ну что,начнём!Портал 2 игра которая захватила многие сердца,не всех но многих!
Это игра попалась мне в 2011(я про первую часть)!Тогда я был ребенком и прошёл первую,хоть и с маленькой продолжительностью,потом после того как я вырос,я увидел портал 2 в стиме(в 2014)!И решил купить!Игра очень классная,но минусы присутствуют!
Начнем с плюсов:

1.Новые испытания-Лазеры,гели,мосты увеличивают сложность,но лично не мне!
2.Персонажи и сюжет-Сюжет очень тревожный,волнуешся за Челл и за ГлЭДОС(Если не играл,но сори)
Новый персонаж это Уитли,лично для меня,в этой игре он показал свою темную и злую сторону!
3.ИГРА БОМБА-моё мнение))
Минусы:

1.Озвучка-некоторые слова не озвучены,поэтому субтитры тут должны быть включены,слова которые были,они повторяются,после чего я больше не замечал этих повторов!

Ну это всё,спасибо за внимание!

The first Portal game was the best I've ever played, but Portal 2 is even better.
Fantastic concept and sequel to the original.

Generalidades:
Sigue el mismo estilo que su predecesora; Juego en primera persona, con la mecánica de portales para una mezcla de puzzles y thriller.
Si se ha jugado a la entrega anterior (lo que es muy recomendable) en un inicio creemos que la historia no nos va ha sorprender, pero sin duda acaba sorprendiendo y se disfruta.
Incluye Modo Multijugador.

Jugabilidad:
Añade nuevas mecánicas con respecto a la primera entrega, añadiendo a su vez mayor complejidad a los puzzles.

Gráficos:
Algo mejorados respecto a la primera entrega; siguen siendo unos graficos que permiten disfrutar de la ambientación y escenarios.

Duración:
8-12h, dependiendo de el tiempo que te lleve resolver los puzzles.
La duración puede ampliarse por el Modo Multijugador y niveles creados por la comunidad.

Valoración:
Segunda entrega que mantiene un nivel que respeta totalmente a su predecesora, con una mayor variedad de mecánicas y mayor cantidad de horas de juego, además de el Modo Multijugador.
Puede encontrarse rebajado a precio irrisorio (2-3€).

Likeable characters? Check.

All these components mixed together to make a fantastic sequel to a fantastic game? Check.
Worth the price? Absolutely.

Imagine a game that combines puzzles, humor, and atmosphere in a seamless package of science. 

Now stop imagining, because it exists. 

"Portal 2" is the followup to the hit non-secondary game "Portal". It's pretty good and like its sequel the primary means of gameplay is built around portals, or gateways you control. The execution of this concept is what carries the game. "Portal 2" also mixes up the formula nearly every other "level" to keep players on their toes. 

The story, presentation, and music are great too. Areas tend to keep a particular theme, with the humor and commentary playing off areas implictly and blatantly. Unless you're a cyborg with a particular humorless OS or a guy/gal with bad taste, you'll chuckle or snort at least once. 

 It's a fantastic way to spend an afternoon or life, depending on how clever you are. 

Highly recommended. It's usually on sale too, so no rush.
Portal 2 Is a Fantastic Game it is so worth £14.99 it tests your mind and heart to challenging levels and portals are awesome
